Reviews.Title: “Not so bad...but not so good...”
Reviews.Author: Sustasa
Reviews.Content: We were not able to stay at our usual Hotel during a recent return to Venice. Ca' Fontanea was available. It is in a quiet area of Venice, away from the crowds. Everything about the Hotel was simply average. If you arrive after 7 pm, you will need to find the keys and let yourself in. The Bed was lumpy, the rooms were noisy, but the cable TV was above average for Venice. I have to say that the staff, when available, were kind, helpful and respectful. The Breakfast was very nice and included in the price. It is not great, but not terrible either. Your Italian language skills will come in handy as the staff speaks rudimentary English. Charming walk from San Marco.

Reviews.Title: “lights out”
Reviews.Author: Nat25M
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed in the Ormesini appartment which is closer to San Marco than the others rooms offered by Ca' Fontanea so location wasn;t bad. Also the ormesini appartment was the only one with a breakfast room which was overlooking the canal. These were the only pluses of this appartment. The trouble started when one night we stayed in our room and after switching on the cooker and the heater the lights went out and in the middle of the night i had to go out of the room and go down a long very dark (pitch black) corridor to check the main switch. After coming back to the room an other 10 minutes passed and light went out again and i had to do the same procedure over again. Basically, this problem persisted for an other couple of times each time going out with a torch to check the main switch. To make things worse this corridor was open to the road outside. Also room wasn't very clean to start with, such as the pillows cases had stains on them. The hotel/appartment offer gifts to guests who spend their birthday,anniversary with them but because i booked with booking.com the hotel staff said that I couldn't avail myself from this. Also we paid a lot for this appartment but because it is an "appartment" we were treated with less respect i.e. no-one offered any help with anything during our stay. All in all if you have to stay somewhere stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recomended”
Reviews.Author: Netdiver
Reviews.Content: A great little hotel that me and my family certainly loved. Roomy, clean, quiet and relatively cheap (for Venice standards) is highly recommended. The only dissandvandage was that transportation isnâ€™t very convenient on the way back to Piazzale Roma. Vapporeto no 52 takes you very close to the hotel but goes only to one direction, so going back to the Railway station or to Piazzale Roma needs about 15 min walking or a taxi (around 50 â‚¬). Of course this is something that stands for the majority of Venice hotels. I would definitely go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Small but really beautiful hotel in Canareggio, Venice”
Reviews.Author: schuh_10
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed at the Ca' Fontanea hotel in Venice in May 2011. From "Piazzale Roma" where the Ryanair bus stop is located, the hotel is in a walking distance and you don't need to take one of the steamers. In a little alley close to the estuary of the canal the hotel is located in a quiet area. Due to a late check and misunderstanding at the first day we stayed in the "suite" on the second floor which also has a small kitchen and a wooden balcony. It was a brilliant atmosphere and you didn't hear anyone else. For the next 3 nights we stayed in the room we originally booked. It was located right next to the room were breakfast was served but still very big. As the walls are thin you could hear noises from the breakfast room starting around 07.30 - which was not a problem for us at all since we came to Venice to see the city. People who want to sleep in, better stay in one of the rooms on the first/second floor. Breakfast was good (rolls, cereals, yoghurts, different croissants, jam, honey, nutella, ....) and absolutely satisfactory for the size of the hotel. Overall the staff was really friendly and helpful (e.g. for trips to Burano/Murano) and the area is really good as both Rialto and San Marco are in a walking distance (30min max). Right around the corner of the hotel was a small construction site - but again, we never heard the builders so it wasn't a problem either. The only negative aspect was the shower in the bathroom. As it is right under a skewness/slant, tall people might have some problems while showering. Overall we'd stay in the hotel again and can really recommend the place to other people!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little B&B, great value”
Reviews.Author: SignoraL
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came for my birthday and found Ca' Fontanea charming. It was clean and looks recently refurbished. The service was great too. It is a little challenging to find at first but once you find it you realise how easy it is to locate - bring a map! This was my third trip to Venice and this is the best value place that I have stayed in. It's also lovely to be off the beaten track, especially on the busy Carnivale weekend. The breakfast was the usual continental breakfast but all was fresh and tasty. I would definitely recommend Ca' Fontanea to others and if we are ever fortunate enough to be back in Venice we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Received a different room than I booked.”
Reviews.Author: AmareLaVita
Reviews.Content: I want to first say that Beatrice & staff were very friendly, and our room was nicely cleaned each day. Before I decided on this B&B, I read all of the reviews, and looked at all of the pictures taken. I saw someone's picture of a "triple" room that looked really spacious and had a nice white sofa in it. This looked like the perfect place for our first time in Venice, so I began emailing Beatrice. I asked for the triple room, and confirmed that it was indeed the room with the white couch and little kitchenette. She assured me that they were one and the same, so I proceeded to book the room. Upon arrival, we were shown to our room, which was on the top floor---which turned out to be the equivalent of an attic. I asked if this was the triple room, and she said that it was. I was extremely tired from our 15 hour flight, and had just caught a cold, so at that point I just settled for the room that was given us. But this definitely was NOT like the pictures I had seen online. (Please check out my photos). This room has a tiny balcony that you can climb up to, a small kitchenette, and a very small bathroom. The bed was king sized and comfortable. It also has a small TV (which is only viewable from the bed). The main drawback to this room was the height of the ceiling--I am very short, and I hit my head on the overhead beams many times, as did my husband. The room seemed dark and made me feel claustrophobic. There are only a small handful of rooms, and some of the stairs sound hollow, so we were able to hear everyone who came and went. I am not writing this review to bash the B&B-- I only want people to have a fair representation of the facts, since I have not seen another review on this particular room. The other rooms reviewed are white and spacious looking, which is what I expected to get upon arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in Cannaregio”
Reviews.Author: pliumbum
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the outskirts of Venice proper - you can see the mainland from a nearby fondamente. It is not so far away from the Santa Lucia station, although you need to pass a number of stairs on the way, and it can be tricky with luggages. Alternatively, it is two vaporetto stops away. The reception only works in the morning, so it may be a problem to some travellers who need assistance later in the day. There is a phone number you can call, but we didn't need anything and did not call. The room was okay, it had a TV, good bathroom and shower facilities, a fridge (disguised as a simple cupboard, you need to look for it). The area around is very quiet and the sleep will not be disturbed. Nearby you will several pizzerias and bars, and a bit further - some shopping areas. The vaporettos stopping nearby bring you to Murano, train station, Rialto, and San Marco.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ArdmoreTraveler
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel because it described itself much like a B&B, or something local and personal in Venice. We wanted to avoid the tourist crunch and get at least a taste of local Venice. The location delivers, as it is located in a remote section in a local neighborhood. This we liked very much. The hotel, however, does not deliver on a number of items. The innkeepers are not on site as described, the reception desk is only open from 8:30-noon, and the breakfast is basic. If one encounters a problem, you are instructed to call the person who lives next door (who also does the maintenance and cleaning). We got the impression that the owners have lost interest and are taking as much profit out of the enterprise as they can.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: lilB-Chicago
Reviews.Content: I spent one night in Venice this November and stayed at Ca'Fontanea. Overall this is a perfectly acceptable hotel, but there were three points which merit the mediocre review. First, the room was pretty dreadful -- we wound up with a basement room with little privacy, where we could hear everything at the front desk and in the breakfast area (and likely vice versa!) but also that individuals walking outside on the street could look into our room (the curtains were very thin). The mattress was not nice. Second, breakfast was also dreadful (the coffee machine does not produce anything that tastes like coffee, albeit it claims to be able to do so). Third, the staff are not present in the afternoons -- so thank goodness we arrived early in the day! Our experience with the service, however, was fantastic -- we were easily allowed a late check out, the staff were friendly and helpful. However, I would think carefully before staying in this hotel. Not a bad place, but not a four star hotel either.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet”
Reviews.Author: SwedenMike
Reviews.Content: Small but fantastic hotel in quiet outskirts of Venice, we where well taken care of at check in. We got a special room at top floor with a terazz of our own, truly spectacular. Lots of nice restaurants in the surrondings, and just a short boat (vaparetto) tour to the main tourist places.

Reviews.Title: “best value, great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lctraveltalk
Reviews.Content: My adult son and I stayed there for 2 nights in September 2009. We arrived on train and walked from the train station to the hotel around 5:30pm. It was about a 15 minutes walk and was manageable. Upon arrival we found the entrance to the building locked. There was a note on the door saying we could contact Mr. Wang in the next building, but no one answered at either place. We waited around for 15 minutes until someone finally buzzed us in. On the front desk there was a letter waiting for us with 2 keys, one to get into the building (!), the other is the room key. The letter said we could check-in and pay for our stay at breakfast the next morning. It also gave some general information about transportation around the area. Our room was on the first floor (one floor above the lobby). I had trouble with the key to get into the room but luckily my son got it to work. The room was very clean and cozy, nice hardwood floor. We had no complaints whatsoever, there is nothing fancy but it had everything we needed. Venice hotels are expensive, but this little place is a rare gem at such reasonable price. This hotel is in a very quiet neighborhood away from the tourist area, nice and comfortable. The next morning when we went down for breakfast, we met Beatrice and paid for our hotel stay in cash. We also found out we could have wi-fi for the entire stay for 5 euros. We got the ID and password from her, and were able to connect without much problem. Beatrice the nice young lady at the front desk only works during the day. I donâ€™t know what time her shift ends but after she leaves there would be no one there until the next morning. So make sure you have a detail map and directions on how to get to the hotel if you arrive in the afternoon or evening, because no one will be there to answer the phone or to help you. Also if you want wi-fi, you canâ€™t get the ID and password until you see Beatrice the next day. You would love this place if you are independent enough and donâ€™t need any help or anything from the hotel staff. They do have many guidebooks in English on the bookshelves in the lobby in case you need info. We checked out the hotel on a Saturday morning after 2 nights stay, and the nice gentleman there that morning (found out he is the hotel owner, Beatrice is his daughter-in-law) doesnâ€™t speak any English. Luckily the housekeeper Mr. Wang was around and he translated for us. They were fine with us leaving our luggage in the lobby until that afternoon, and allowed us to keep the key to the building for that reason. We returned to retrieve our luggage at 3pm and there was no one there. We took the private water bus line Alilaguna A from the Ponte delle Guglie stop nearby directly to the airport for 13 euro per person. The 12/24/36 hour transportation pass in Venice could not be used for this line but this really is the easiest and fastest way to go to airport from the hotel. This place is really more of a B&B than a hotel. We would definitely stay there if we ever visit Venice again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and Easy Access to all the sights”
Reviews.Author: tromatt
Reviews.Content: Beatrice is very welcoming and has a good knowledge of the city. She provides an excellent continental breakfast in the small but perfectly adequate breakfast area. The hotel room was well maintained and kept clean daily. The hotel was easy to find from the water bus from the airport on day 1 and with the Crea water bus stop close by, it was easy to get around. There are a number of waterside eateries between the Grand Canal and the Tre Archi bridge. The Cannareggio area is less touristy, but still has tourists around and is we were well catered for with restaurants, cafes, ATM's, shops all within a few minutes walk. Just for a bit of info, a taxi from Pazzale Roma to the Cruise ship port was 15 eu incl luggage and from the port to the airport was 40eu incl luggage, and that journey was done in approx 20 mins.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: metromama
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights here but our experience was not as favourable as other guests. We had top floor room - very difficult to lug suitcases up funny little staircase. The bathroom has no bath and shower was only a hand shower in a cubicle. No internet which was very inconvenient although Beatrice (owner?) did allow us to use hers on the last day. No hairdryer in the room but after complaining one was produced the next day. Funny little TV which didn't work. Breakfast was very minimilist. The curtains were rags and didn't fit across the windows or close properly. Fairly close to the water taxi and several restaurants but quite a walk from the central areas.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Seniordublin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights. It was spotless and tastefully furnished. Unfortunately my husband's wallet was stolen while we were sight-seeing on the Rialto Bridge with the result that we had no Bank Card, Visa etc. and very little cash. The owners, Beatrice and Fabio, were most understanding and kind to us. While Hotel is not in Centre, it is in a very pleasant quiet area with several good restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “A nice getaway from the tourist crowd”
Reviews.Author: feichyan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Ca'Fontanea for two nights while visiting Venice. The hotel is not central but all major sights are within easy reach by the waterbus. Our room was small but very clean and quiet. Breakfast was nothing to rave about but sufficient. If you have more than a day to spend in Venice and would like to get away from the crowd, then this is a great place. After booking, the hotel owner (Beatrice) was very responsive about our questions and gave us detailed directions on getting to the hotel from the airport. Would definitely stay here again next time.

Reviews.Title: “A great find”
Reviews.Author: KeenTraveller_26_9
Reviews.Content: This little B&B was in the quiet part of town but only 10mins stroll to the Grand Canal. Rooms are spacious and very clean. Staff were extremely helpful. It has restaurants nearby which are very reasonable and food was very good. We will definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quiet but not to far from attractions”
Reviews.Author: bwick22
Reviews.Content: This was a great little hotel for the price. Room was very nice, modern and clean. Away from the noise of central Venice, but not a far walk from great restaurants and the sights. Easy to find upon arrival and very friendly staff. I would reccommend this highly for people with a limited budget but want to stay right in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed.”
Reviews.Author: SeamusOg
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this small b&b during the Carnavale week. It is spotlessly clean. The room was beautiful, we had the top floor room which had its own two tier bacony with great views over Canareggio. The proprietors Beatrice and Fabio were very nice and friendly. They were more than willing to help out with anything you needed. The place is quite small and situated in a residential area so its perfect if you want peace and quiet. Could not fault it really. Could have done with a kettle in the room if anything but that is a very minor point. Nice location right at the north of Canareggio quite close to the edge of the island which would make it a little fresher during the summer. two minutes from Canale Canareggio. Five minutes from Ponte de Tre Archi. Convenient for vaporetti. Loved the fact it was in a very un toursity area (un touristy by Venetian standards anyway). When you walk down the side of the canal toward the Grand canal there is a great little restaurant called Gam Gam on the other side. So, great little B&B, clean, good breakfast, nice people, quiet, convenient. Would certainly stay here again. Finally a word to the wise. if you come here for Carnavale, Venice is really really cold this time of year. very dry and bright but there were polar bears stealing peoples scarves.

Reviews.Title: “This place was amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Zhannuka
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in this hotel in July, 2008. We had a double bed room upstairs, wooden and beautiful! It was very special place, away from crowds and noise! Staff was friendly and helpful. I definitely recommend it !

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Wendy90
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this lovely little hotel. As the other reviewers say, it is in a great location - just out of the way enough to be able to enjoy some authentic local Venetian life, slightly cheaper restaurants and bars and a small lively market street, but very convenient for access to main tourist attractions via vaporettos or on foot. We didn't stay in the main house so cannot comment on the rooms there - we were given an apartment next door which was gorgeous - very spacious and clean with two roof terraces - amazing value and very friendly and helpful staff. Will definitely stay here again when we return to Venice which we hope to very soon!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL AND FIND !!!”
Reviews.Author: constantravel01
Reviews.Content: Ca' Fontanea was an excellent find in Venice. It is a hotel with 6 rooms and our room was great. It was roomy, very clean, and had a spacious private bathroom. Compared to other hotels in Venice it was a great value. It was very easy to find with the hotel directions and close to everything you want to visit in beautiful Venice. The staff is extremly helpful and very nice. They even email you before to make sure you know how to get there and if you have any special requests. Since it is a small hotel, the service is great and they help you with anything you need. I would defenitly come back here on my next visit to Venice. The vaporetto stop is right by the hotel. The breakfast is your standard Italian breakfast, but it was good. Loved this place.

Reviews.Title: “Venice far from the madding crowd”
Reviews.Author: hollyYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Having decided to go at short notice accommodation in our price bracket was limited, and so Ca' Fontanea was a real find. Situated in a quiet, peaceful backwater in Canareggio, in a converted house with a very modern interior. Good access to public transport, and St Mark's square within walking distance. The area was a lively, residential area, with plenty of local bars and restaurants for those wanting somewhere less touristy. The hotel's 6 bedrooms were clean and bright, and the staff went out of their way to be helpful. Breakfast was basic but adequate, but then we werent staying at the Ritz. We would definitely return to this hotel tomorrow!

HotelInfo.Name: Ca' Fontanea
HotelInfo.Address: Cannaregio 786 | Campiello delle Beccarie, 30100 Venice, Italy
